I think he'd clear the field. Mike Pence is from Columbus and was an attorney before running unsuccessfully for Congress against Democrat Phil Sharp in 1988 and 1990. provider of the football pads Michael Vick wore most of last season. The deal will be announced on Thursday.`` We're real excited about it,'' chief executive officer Rob Vito said Tuesday. Michael Vick is good people. He paid his dues. Barack Obama reached out to him. He deserves an opportunity. This is what makes America so great. He's moved forward. He's a whole other person. Vito said Michael Vick is the company's first corporate spokesman. Terms of his deal weren't disclosed. But Vito said it's a`` sizable'' contract.`` We believe it was worth it,

Among them were several that proved prescient, he says: concerns that Washington`` could fail to manage post-Saddam Saddam Hussein Iraq successfully'' and a prediction that Iraq would devolve into ethnic strife among Sunni, Shia and Kurds. In the early post 9-11 period, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld also authorized tougher interrogation methods thought to have contributed to the 2004 Abu Ghraib prison scandal in which American soldiers tortured and humiliated their Iraqi detainees.

know, there's a lot of talk these days around here about where members of Congress are going to sit during the State of the Union address,'' Indiana Republican Mike Pence said recently on the House floor. Well, I've been in Congress for 10 years and I learned a long time ago, it doesn't really matter where you sit- it matters where you stand.
